fields.name: Le Oche
fields.description: Yellow-gold colour, aromas of warm apricots, toasted hazelnuts and creamed ginger, builds in the mouth, and given definition by excellent citrus acidity.

fields.name: Pet Nat vol. 1
fields.grape_varieties: Müller Thurgau, Grüner Veltliner, Sauvignon blanc
fields.description: Pétillant naturale with fine bubbles. A fruity and floral scent with a palate of nectarine, apple, citrus and apricot. Macerated with skins for 12 days.

fields.name: Pet Nat vol. 3
fields.description: Pétillant naturale with fine bubbles. A fruity and floral scent and a palate of nectarine, apple, citrus and apricot. Macerated with skins for 12 days.

fields.name: Coll del Sabater
fields.description: A Bordeaux-style blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc – it’s nice an savoury with a lovely balance between the dark cherry fruit and earthy tannins.

fields.name: La Llopetera
fields.description: Savoury, earthy, spicy nose is quite firm with a hint of pepper. You get different aspects of this each time you smell it, but the savoury spiciness persists. The palate is fresh and savoury with a firm, grippy character and nice lemony acidity. Quite dry, with firm tannins under the cherry and plu

fields.name: Les Paradetes
fields.description: Wonderfully complex, distinctive, spicy, earthy nose with some evolved character. The palate has a grippy, spicy, earthy structure. Quite evolved in one sense, but still with some nice ripe berry and cherry fruit. A distinctive, food-friendly wine for current drinking.

fields.name: Els Bassots
fields.description: It’s unusual to find Chenin Blanc in Spain and this is no ordinary wine – mellow with fleshy citrus and a touch of caramel, perfumed but also earthy, long and complex. Don’t mind the sediment – decant carefully and savourFermented 10 days on skins in stainless steel. Matured one year in neutral oak.

fields.name: Els Bassotets
fields.grape_varieties: Chenin, Parellada, Macabeu, Garnacha Blanca, Sumoll
fields.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. fields.name: Brutal
fields.description: From Joan Ramon Escoda and Carmen Sanahuja, delicate, light, fresh with notes of stawberries, lime and crisp acidity with fine tannins poking through. Made from a small batch of sumoll in amphora, Brutal is named after their part ownership in the bar Brutal in Barcelona.

fields.name: Vej Bianco Antico 270
fields.description: Medium bodied, on the dry side. Strong acidity with citrusy, fruity and floral notes.

fields.name: Velius Rosé Metodo Classico
fields.description: Sparkling rosé from organic grapes, vinification in white by press, without sulphur dioxide, native yeasts. Addition of fresh must for the second fermentation in the bottle, 20 months on the yeasts. Notes of white flowers, apple, interesting high acidity.

fields.name: Velius Rosso Asciutto
fields.description: From organic grapes, long maceration (90 days), without sulphur dioxide, native yeast, without filtration. Ruby red with a touch of violet. Touches of elegant fruit, persistent, Ample, evident and soft tannin, great bodied.

fields.name: Himmel auf Erden Weiss
fields.description: Himmel auf Erden is yellow to golden. The nose expresses beautiful aromas of green apple, apricot, citrus and pepper notes. On the palate it is fresh and firm, scratchy, enveloping and amazes us with its long persistence.

fields.name: Himmel auf Erden Rosé
fields.description: Vinification Method: Grapes are hand harvested, destemmed, and crushed by foot. The juice ferments in large barrels with indigenous yeast and no racking. It spends 1 year aging in 500 to 1500-liter barrels and is bottled without fining or filtering and no addition of sulfur.

fields.name: Himmel auf Erden Maischevergoren
fields.grape_varieties: Scheurebe and several varieties of Muscat
fields.description: Vinification Method: Grapes are hand harvested, destemmed, and crushed by foot. Some of the skins are left in contact with the juice for 2 weeks, and some is left in contact for 4 weeks, making Christian’s only orange wine. The juice ferments in large barrels with indigenous yeast and no racking. It

fields.name: Himmel auf Erden Red
fields.description: Vinification Method: Grapes are hand harvested, destemmed, and crushed by foot. The juice ferments in large barrels with indigenous yeast and no racking. It spends 1 year aging in 500 to 1500-liter barrels and is bottled without fining or filtering and no addition of sulfur.

fields.name: Brutal
fields.description: Grapes are hand harvested, destemmed, and crushed by foot. The juice ferments in 2 large barrels with indigenous yeast and no racking.  It spends 1 year aging in barrel and is bottled without fining or filtering and no addition of sulfur. Bottled in magnum only.

fields.name: Hokus Pokus
fields.description: Grapes are hand harvested, destemmed, and crushed by foot. The juice ferments in large barrels with indigenous yeast and no racking. It spends 1 year aging in large Stockinger barrels and is bottled without fining or filtering and no addition of sulfur. Bottled in magnum only.

fields.name: Waiting for Tom Weiss
fields.description:
Scent: herbal, mild floral and pear. Fine mineral on the palate, hints of orange peel, apple and exotic fruit. Long, juicy after carried by acidity and vividness.
Rennersistas' Waiting for Tom range is dedicated to Matassa's Tom Lubbe, with whom Stefanie Renner has learnt winemaking.

fields.name: Waiting for Tom Rosé
fields.description: Waiting for Tom range is dedicated to Matassa's Tom Lubbe, with whom Stefanie Renner has learnt winemaking.

fields.name: Waiting for Tom Red
fields.description:
Hints of blackcurrants, red berries and ripe fruitiness, light herbal spiciness.
Waiting for Tom range is dedicated to Matassa's Tom Lubbe, with whom Stefanie Renner has learnt winemaking.

fields.name: Welschriesling
fields.description: Full scent of green apple, orange peel and mild herbs, that integrates into full fruitiness on the palate. Versatility with hints of peaches and light florals on the palate. Mineral acidity gives liveliness and makes this wine a well-rounded package.

fields.name: Brutal Orange Macabeo
fields.description:
Full and aromatic nose with loads of herbs and citrus. Dry and full on the palate with fantastic aroma lingering in the mouth. Gorgeously vivacious and fresh with pleasant acidity that gives a bit of robustness.
Tom Lubbe created this wine for the legendary Bar Brutal in Barcelona.

fields.name: Radikon Slatnik
fields.description: 12 days on the skins, biodynamic wine, complex yet easy drinking. From one of the greats of natural wine, and a family that is as generous as they are amazing at winemaking and grape growing. Superb expression here, if not one of their most complex of all. Landmark orange wine.

fields.name: Radikon Modri
fields.description: Smoothness allied to a tannic structure, which makes itself known on the very long finish. This wine has an arresting presence. Not a pinot drinkers pinot..
